did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: One volume of session meeting minutes with baptisms and membership lists (1866-1910), one volume of annual meeting minutes of the trustees (1866-1944), subscription lists (1860-1876) and lists of financial records (1861-1866).

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1860 the Presbyterian Society of Fairville was established. Prior to the opening of the meeting house in 1862, the Presbyterian Society met in the old Methodist meeting house or in the village school or courthouse. The Presbyterian Church of Fairville was officially organized in 1866 with eighteen members. The church supported several religious groups, among them a Sunday school, Christian Endeavor Society, Ladies Aid Society, Missonary Society and Bible School.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: One volume of session meeting minutes with baptisms and membership lists (1866-1910), one volume of annual meeting minutes of the trustees (1866-1944), subscription lists (1860-1876) and lists of financial records (1861-1866).

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Not to be published or otherwise released in such form that any individual mentioned in the records can be identified.
